title: Opening Act
text:
The Activities Committee ask me to perform.
To open the Ward Dance Party.
By this time, my, instinctive, automatic reply was YES, of course.
Then the struggle began.
What to do for the opening act.
Ran my selection by a member, a former DJ himself.
Bishop K, it doesn’t matter what the number is, they like you.
Therefore they will like the number.
Finally, settled on 붏은노을
Struggled and rehearsed for a better part of a month

title: Opening Act
text:
The performed version
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=laTwNsKrGrE&list=RDlaTwNsKrGrE&start_radio=1
My performance to open the Dance fell far short of expectations, both Ward Members and myself.
But I didn’t mind.
At my age, just being asked to perform was enough.
Then choosing a song from the 1980s, remade in 2008, performed by the original singer in a award ceremony in 2019
Lastly akwardly performed by a Bishop of a YSA Ward.
The song had a uniting effect, spanning nearly 4 decades of audiences

title: Thy Name
text:
Korean names were no issue, even if they had a double character name like 남궁 or 제갈, I could remember them
Chinese surnames were bit more challenging.
林 can be pronounced either, Lim / Im / Lam / Lin depending on the location within Asia.
Visits to Taiwan, China, HK, and Singapore had prepared me.
Likewise, 陳 can be Tran, Chen, Chin, Chan, Chun or Tan
Japanese would have been more challenging.
Except I had been working with Japanese company for the past 5 years.
I had learned to distinguish the given name from the family name.
And understood some of the Kanji that defined the 2 character surnames.
Phillipines was easy, familiar and short
Mongolia wasn’t. Long and unfamiliar

title: Life Among Young People
text:
Got a call from a source, one normally tries to avoid.
The Stake Presidency of the BYU Young Singles Adult Stake wanted to meet one Saturday afternoon.
However, upon meeting a Stake Presidency member, we listened to the role.
We deliberated and took it.
Next day, we attended the Ward and we were sustained and set apart.
Thus began a 5 year journey
That was August of 2017

Recently ran into people from that period.
Once in a Temple and another in a Thai Restaurant.
Perhaps it was a random meeting or occurrence.
Took it as a blessing from above that reminded me of a period in my life that was most meaningful.

title: Refreshments & Nourishment
text:
A sister from HK, upon seeing the food, remarked.

It is real food.

The food was simple, modern version of 비빔밥.
Think she was expecting some refreshment instead.
Growing up, gathering meant food.
More exquisite the food, more special the gathering
When does refreshment become a nourishment.
Can nourishment turn into a renewal of the body and spirit.
And when the tempter came to him, he said, If thou be the Son of God, command that these stones be made bread.
But he answered and said, It is written, Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word that proceedeth out of the mouth of God.
Matthew 4:3,4

title: Zoom Meetings
text:
Was a year into the role when the unexpected occurred.
What started as a 2 weeks of precautionary measure turned into a months-long shutdown.

title: Zoom Meetings
text:
Depression and Anxiety
Began hearing this term regularly during those period.
I myself experienced this, after hearing gloom and doom incessantly, I began to fear for the future. Specifcally if future had a place for me.
